title: Банкомат
licensing_note: Lyrics fetched via Musixmatch API; translations via local Ollama.

lines.translation: If you want to be with me
lines.grammar: The verb 'хотеть' (to want) is in the infinitive form, indicating a desire or intention.

lines.translation: Bring me your vouchers
After all, the world is so changeable
After all, the world is so deceptive
It's three o'clock at night.
We are standing at the ATM
Happiness is definitely not about money
But I am rich with money
Euros, dollars, rubles
I am happy with any currency
There is no love in the ATM

lines.text: Но её мне и не надо
lines.translation: But I don't need it.
It's already 11:00 on my watch.
Get ready, honey, we're going to the Metropol.

lines.text: Не волнуйся, за такси я скоро заплачу
lines.translation: Don't worry, I'll pay for the taxi soon.

lines.text: Жить красиво — это сложно, но я научу
lines.translation: Living beautifully is difficult, but I will teach you

lines.text: Видишь справа мужика в том вельветовом костюме?
lines.translation: See that guy on the right in that corduroy suit?

lines.text: У него три кабака и гостиница в Батуми
lines.translation: He has three pubs and a hotel in Batumi.

lines.text: Или как тебе вот тот? Из Америки вернулся
lines.translation: Or how about that one? He came back from America.

lines.text: Он за нас оплатит счёт, стоит только улыбнуться
lines.translation: He'll pay the bill for us, just smile.
It's three o'clock at night.
We are standing at the ATM
Happiness is definitely not about money
But I am rich with money
Euros, dollars, rubles
I am happy with any currency
There is no love in the ATM

lines.text: Но её мне и не надо
lines.translation: But I don't need it.

lines.text: Летом на Майорку отвезёт тебя майор
lines.translation: The major will take you to Mallorca this summer

lines.text: А зимой тебя согреет шуба от Dior
lines.translation: And in winter, a fur coat from Dior will keep you warm.

lines.text: Может, счастье ты себе не купишь, ну и что?
lines.translation: Maybe happiness is something you can't buy, so what?
lines.grammar: The phrase 'ну и что' is an idiomatic expression that roughly translates to 'so what?' or 'oh well?' and is often used to express resignation or indifference.

lines.text: Быть несчастной лучше в лимузине, чем пешком
lines.translation: It's better to be unhappy in a limousine than on foot.
Calculate everything like a computer
Be smarter, but not too smart
It's not beauty that will save the world.
My savings book will save the world
Don't look at me like that.

lines.text: Знаешь, ведь не в правде сила
lines.translation: You know, power is not in truth
I didn't sell out to the Kremlin
I would buy it myself
If you want to be with me
Bring me your vouchers
After all, the world is so changeable
After all, the world is so deceptive
It's three o'clock at night.
We are standing at the ATM
Happiness is definitely not about money
But I am rich with money
Euros, dollars, rubles
I am happy with any currency
There is no love in the ATM

lines.text: Но её мне и не надо
lines.translation: But I don't need it.
"For me, the main thing is not money."

lines.text: "Перестань, не глупи! Ты же не хочешь, чтобы у тебя был брак без любви?"
lines.translation: "Stop it, don't be silly! You don't want to have a loveless marriage, do you?"
"For me? Without love?"

lines.text: "Конечно! Ведь если девушка всё своё время тратит на то, чтобы заработать деньги
lines.translation: "Of course! After all, if a girl spends all her time trying to earn money

lines.text: То у неё просто не хватит сил на любовь!"
lines.translation: Then she simply doesn’t have enough strength for love!”
